fields.description:
The mail component:

[https://camel.apache.org/components/4.14.x/mail-component.html]

has the option

*headerFilterStrategy*

I'm trying to use this option from a Kamelet like this:


{code:java}
  template:
    beans:
      - name: ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy
        type: "#class:org.assimbly.util.mail.ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy"
    route:
      from:
        uri: "kamelet:source"
        steps:
          - toD:
              uri: "smtp://smpt.google.com?headerFilterStrategy=#bean:ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy"
          - to:
              uri: "kamelet:sink" {code}

or like this:


{code:java}
registry.bind("ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy", new ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy()); {code}
 
{code:java}
  template:
    route:
      from:
        uri: "kamelet:source"
        steps:
          - toD:
              uri: "smtp://smpt.google.com?headerFilterStrategy=#ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy"

              uri: "kamelet:sink" {code}

comments.body:
I checked the routeTemplate documentation. There it seems that it needs to be set on creation of the route, but I think it's possible to set it on the template itself. I just missed the double curly braces:


{code:java}
template:
  beans:
    - name: ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy
      type: "#class:org.assimbly.util.mail.ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy"
  route:
    from:
      uri: "kamelet:source"
      steps:
        - toD:
            uri: "smtp://smtp.google.com?headerFilterStrategy=#{{ExtendedHeaderFilterStrategy}}"
        - to:
            uri: "kamelet:sink" {code}

I think the confusion comes from that the syntax \{{xxx}} is normally used for variables set on creation, whereas in a normal routes the reference to beans are defined "hardcoded", so the value of the query parameter never changes. The property placeholder functionality to make the bean unique feels a bit like a workaround. It also doesn't seem to let use the registry normally (like I gave in the second example).

I recently saw this ticket https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CAMEL-22571 and thought it was a similar issue. You can close the ticket, but I guess I am not the only one that will be confused about this. Could the error message be made clearer for example?
